   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %% There are some environment variables that can be used to "manipulate"
   22: %% the test suite: 
   23: %%
   24: %% Variable that controls "verbosity" of the test case(s):
   25: %%
   26: %%         ESOCK_TEST_QUIET: true (default) | false
   27: %%
   28: %% Defines the runtime of the ttest cases
   29: %% (This is the time during which "measurement" is performed. 
   30: %%  the actual time it takes for the test case to complete
   31: %%  will be longer; setup, completion, ...)
   32: %%
   33: %%          ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_RUNTIME: 1 second
   34: %%              Format of values: <integer>[<unit>]
   35: %%              Where unit is: ms | s | m
   36: %%                 ms - milli seconds
   37: %%                 s  - seconds (default)
   38: %%                 m  - minutes
   39: %%
   40: %% The ttest takes a long time to run, even when the runtime is small,
   41: %% because there are such a large number of test cases.
   42: %% So, by default only the 'small' test cases are included in a test run.
   43: %% The following environment variables control which are included and 
   44: %% excluded.
   45: %%
   46: %%          ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_SMALL:  included
   47: %%          ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_MEDIUM: excluded
   48: %%          ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_LARGE:  excluded
   49: %%
   50: 
   51: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   52: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]).
   53: %%
   54: %% Run a specific group:
   55: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   56: %%
   57: %% Run a specific test case:
   58: %% ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   59: %%
   60: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   61: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   62: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   63: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   64: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}]) end.
   65: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   66: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   67: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   68: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   69: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   70: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, socket_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   71: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, socket_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   72: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   73: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   74: %%
   75: %% Some official info about AF_UNIX
   76: %% https://devblogs.microsoft.com/commandline/windowswsl-interop-with-af_unix/
   77: 
   78: 
   79: 
   80: -module(socket_ttest_SUITE).
   81: 
   82: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   83: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct_event.hrl").
   84: -include("socket_test_evaluator.hrl").
   85: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   86: 
   87: %% Suite exports
   88: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
   89: -export([init_per_suite/1,    end_per_suite/1,
   90:          init_per_group/2,    end_per_group/2,
   91:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).

  409:          ttest_ssockt_csockt_small_tcpL/1,
  410:          ttest_ssockt_csockt_medium_tcp4/1,
  411:          ttest_ssockt_csockt_medium_tcp6/1,
  412:          ttest_ssockt_csockt_medium_tcpL/1,
  413:          ttest_ssockt_csockt_large_tcp4/1,
  414:          ttest_ssockt_csockt_large_tcp6/1,
  415:          ttest_ssockt_csockt_large_tcpL/1,
  416: 
  417:          ttest_simple_ssockt_csocko_small_tcp4/1,
  418:          ttest_simple_ssockt_csocko_small_tcp6/1,
  419:          ttest_simple_ssockt_csocko_small_tcpL/1
  420: 
  421:         ]).
  422: 
  423: 
  424: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  425: 
  426: -define(SLIB,       socket_test_lib).
  427: -define(KLIB,       kernel_test_lib).
  428: -define(TTEST_LIB,  socket_test_ttest_lib).
  429: -define(LOGGER,     socket_test_logger).
  430: 
  431: -define(TPP_SMALL,  lists:seq(1, 8)).
  432: -define(TPP_MEDIUM, lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_SMALL))).
  433: -define(TPP_LARGE,  lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(100, ?TPP_MEDIUM))).
  434: 
  435: -define(TPP_SMALL_NUM,  5000).
  436: -define(TPP_MEDIUM_NUM, 500).
  437: -define(TPP_LARGE_NUM,  50).
  438: -define(TPP_NUM(Config, Base), (Base) div lookup(kernel_factor, 1, Config)).
  439: 
  440: -define(WINDOWS, {win32,nt}).
  441: 
  442: -define(TTEST_RUNTIME,                       ?SECS(1)).
  443: -define(TTEST_MIN_FACTOR,                    3).
  444: -define(TTEST_MIN_FACTOR_WIN,                ?TTEST_MIN_FACTOR-1).
  445: -define(TTEST_DEFAULT_SMALL_MAX_OUTSTANDING, 50).
  446: -define(TTEST_DEFAULT_MEDIUM_MAX_OUTSTANDING,
  447:         ?TTEST_MK_DEFAULT_MAX_OUTSTANDING(
  448:            ?TTEST_DEFAULT_SMALL_MAX_OUTSTANDING)).
  449: -define(TTEST_DEFAULT_LARGE_MAX_OUTSTANDING,
  450:         ?TTEST_MK_DEFAULT_MAX_OUTSTANDING(
  451:            ?TTEST_DEFAULT_MEDIUM_MAX_OUTSTANDING)).
  452: 
  453: -define(TTEST_MK_DEFAULT_MAX_OUTSTANDING(__X__),
  454:         if ((__X__) >= 5) ->
  455:                 (__X__) div 5;
  456:            true ->
  457:                 1
  458:         end).
  459: 
  460: 
  461: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  462: 
  463: suite() ->
  464:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
  465:      {timetrap, {minutes,1}}].
  466: 
  467: all() -> 
  468:     Groups = [{ttest, "ESOCK_TEST_TTEST", include}],
  469:     [use_group(Group, Env, Default) || {Group, Env, Default} <- Groups].
  470: 
  471: use_group(_Group, undefined, exclude) ->
  472:     [];
  473: use_group(Group, undefined, _Default) ->
  474:     [{group, Group}];
  475: use_group(Group, Env, Default) ->
  476: 	case os:getenv(Env) of
  477: 	    false when (Default =:= include) ->
  478: 		[{group, Group}];
  479: 	    false ->
  480: 		[];
  481: 	    Val ->
  482: 		case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  483: 		    Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  484: 			     (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  485: 			     (Use =:= true) ->
  486: 			[{group, Group}];
  487: 		    _ ->
  488: 			[]
  489: 		end
  490: 	end.
  491:     
  492:

  559: 
  560: %% Condition for running the ttest cases.
  561: %% No point in running these cases unless the machine is
  562: %% reasonably fast.
  563: ttest_condition(Config) ->
  564:     OsType = os:type(),
  565:     case ?config(kernel_factor, Config) of
  566:         Factor when (OsType =:= ?WINDOWS) andalso
  567:                     is_integer(Factor) andalso
  568:                     (Factor =< ?TTEST_MIN_FACTOR_WIN) ->
  569:             ok;
  570:         Factor when is_integer(Factor) andalso (Factor =< ?TTEST_MIN_FACTOR) ->
  571:             ok;
  572:         Factor when is_integer(Factor) ->
  573:             {skip, ?F("Too slow for TTest (~w)", [Factor])};
  574:         _ ->
  575:             {skip, "Too slow for TTest (undef)"}
  576:     end.
  577: 
  578: ttest_small_max_outstanding(Config) ->
  579:     EnvKey                = "ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_SMALL_MAX_OUTSTANDING",
  580:     Default               = ?TTEST_DEFAULT_SMALL_MAX_OUTSTANDING,
  581:     DefaultMaxOutstanding = ttest_max_outstanding(Config, EnvKey, Default),
  582:     ttest_max_outstanding(Config, DefaultMaxOutstanding).
  583: 
  584: ttest_medium_max_outstanding(Config) ->
  585:     SmallMaxOutstanding   = ttest_small_max_outstanding(Config),
  586:     EnvKey                = "ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_MEDIUM_MAX_OUTSTANDING",
  587:     Default               = ?TTEST_MK_DEFAULT_MAX_OUTSTANDING(
  588:                                SmallMaxOutstanding),
  589:     DefaultMaxOutstanding = ttest_max_outstanding(Config, EnvKey, Default),
  590:     ttest_max_outstanding(Config, DefaultMaxOutstanding).
  591: 
  592: ttest_large_max_outstanding(Config) ->
  593:     MediumMaxOutstanding  = ttest_medium_max_outstanding(Config),
  594:     EnvKey                = "ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_LARGE_MAX_OUTSTANDING",
  595:     Default               = ?TTEST_MK_DEFAULT_MAX_OUTSTANDING(
  596:                                MediumMaxOutstanding),
  597:     DefaultMaxOutstanding = ttest_max_outstanding(Config, EnvKey, Default),
  598:     ttest_max_outstanding(Config, DefaultMaxOutstanding).
  599: 
  600: ttest_max_outstanding(Config, Default)
  601:   when is_integer(Default) andalso (Default > 1) ->
  602:     %% Note that we should not even get here if factor > 4
  603:     case ?config(kernel_factor, Config) of
  604:         1                     -> Default;
  605:         2 when (Default >= 2) -> Default div 2;
  606:         3 when (Default >= 4) -> Default div 4;
  607:         _ when (Default >= 8) -> Default div 8;
  608:         _                     -> 1
  609:     end;
  610: ttest_max_outstanding(_, _) ->
  611:     1.
  612: 
  613: ttest_max_outstanding(Config, EnvKey, Default) ->
  614:     Key = list_to_atom(string:to_lower(EnvKey)),
  615:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
  616:         {value, {Key, MO}} when is_integer(MO) andalso (MO > 0) ->
  617:             MO;
  618:         _ ->
  619:             case os:getenv(EnvKey) of
  620:                 false ->
  621:                     Default;
  622:                 Val ->
  623:                     try list_to_integer(Val) of
  624:                         MO when (MO > 0) ->
  625:                             MO;
  626:                         _ ->
  627:                             1
  628:                     catch
  629:                         _:_:_ ->
  630:                             Default
  631:                     end
  632:             end
  633:     end.
  634:

  689: 
  690: ttest_conditional_cases(Env, Default, Cases) ->
  691:     case os:getenv(Env) of
  692:         false ->
  693:             Default;
  694:         Val ->
  695:             case list_to_atom(string:to_lower(Val)) of
  696:                 Use when (Use =:= include) orelse 
  697:                          (Use =:= enable) orelse 
  698:                          (Use =:= true) ->
  699:                     Cases;
  700:                 _ -> % Assumed to be explicitly *disabled*
  701:                     []
  702:             end
  703:     end.
  704: 
  705: ttest_small_conditional_cases(Cases) ->
  706:     ttest_conditional_cases("ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_SMALL", Cases, Cases).
  707: 
  708: ttest_medium_conditional_cases(Cases) ->
  709:     ttest_conditional_cases("ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_MEDIUM", [], Cases).
  710: 
  711: ttest_large_conditional_cases(Cases) ->
  712:     ttest_conditional_cases("ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_LARGE", [], Cases).
  713: 
  714: ttest_select_conditional_cases(Small, Medium, Large) ->
  715:     ttest_small_conditional_cases(Small) ++
  716:         ttest_medium_conditional_cases(Medium) ++
  717:         ttest_large_conditional_cases(Large).
  718: 
  719: ttest_sgenf_cgenf_cases() ->

  721:       %% Small

 1377: ttest_ssockt_csocko_cases() ->
 1378:     ttest_select_conditional_cases(
 1379:       %% Small
 1380:       [ttest_ssockt_csocko_small_tcp4,
 1381:        ttest_ssockt_csocko_small_tcp6,
 1382:        ttest_ssockt_csocko_small_tcpL],
 1383:       %% Medium
 1384:       [ttest_ssockt_csocko_medium_tcp4,
 1385:        ttest_ssockt_csocko_medium_tcp6,
 1386:        ttest_ssockt_csocko_medium_tcpL],
 1387:       %% Large
 1388:       [ttest_ssockt_csocko_large_tcp4,
 1389:        ttest_ssockt_csocko_large_tcp6,
 1390:        ttest_ssockt_csocko_large_tcpL]).
 1391:

 1393: %% Client: transport = socket(tcp), active = true
 1394: ttest_ssockt_csockt_cases() ->

 1400:       %% Medium

 1441: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
 1442:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
 1443:        "~n      Config: ~p"
 1444:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
 1445:     
 1446:     try socket:info() of
 1447:         #{} ->
 1448:             case ?KLIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
 1449:                 {skip, _} = SKIP ->
 1450:                     SKIP;
 1451: 
 1452:                 Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
 1453: 
 1454:                     ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
 1455:                        "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
 1456: 
 1457:                     %% We need a monitor on this node also
 1458:                     kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
 1459: 
 1460:                     socket:use_registry(false),
 1461:                     case quiet_mode(Config1) of
 1462:                         default ->
 1463:                             case ?LOGGER:start() of
 1464:                                 ok ->
 1465:                                     Config1;
 1466:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 1467:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
 1468:                                        "Failed starting logger"
 1469:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
 1470:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
 1471:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
 1472:                             end;
 1473:                         Quiet ->
 1474:                             case ?LOGGER:start(Quiet) of
 1475:                                 ok ->
 1476:                                     [{esock_test_quiet, Quiet} | Config1];
 1477:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 1478:                                     ?P("init_per_suite -> "
 1479:                                        "Failed starting logger"
 1480:                                        "~n   Reason: ~p"
 1481:                                        "~n", [Reason]),
 1482:                                     {skip, "Failed starting logger"}
 1483:                             end
 1484:                     end
 1485:             end
 1486:     catch
 1487:         error : notsup ->
 1488:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
 1489:         error : undef ->
 1490:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
 1491:     end.
 1492: 
 1493: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
 1494: 
 1495:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
 1496:        "~n      Config: ~p"
 1497:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
 1498: 
 1499:     %% Stop the local monitor
 1500:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
 1501: 
 1502:     (catch ?LOGGER:stop()),
 1503: 
 1504:     Config1 = ?KLIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
 1505: 
 1506:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
 1507:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
 1508: 
 1509:     Config1.
 1510: 
 1511: 
 1512: init_per_group(ttest = _GroupName, Config) ->
 1513:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
 1514:               "~n   Config: ~p"
 1515:               "~n", [_GroupName, Config]),
 1516:     case ttest_condition(Config) of
 1517:         ok ->
 1518:             ttest_manager_start(),
 1519:             case lists:keysearch(esock_test_ttest_runtime, 1, Config) of
 1520:                 {value, _} ->
 1521:                     Config;
 1522:                 false ->
 1523:                     [{esock_test_ttest_runtime, which_ttest_runtime_env()} |
 1524:                      Config]
 1525:             end;
 1526:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
 1527:             SKIP
 1528:     end;
 1529: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
 1530:     Config.
 1531: 
 1532: end_per_group(ttest = _GroupName, Config) ->
 1533:     io:format("init_per_group(~w) -> entry with"
 1534:               "~n   Config: ~p"
 1535:               "~n", [_GroupName, Config]),
 1536:     ttest_manager_stop(),
 1537:     lists:keydelete(esock_test_ttest_runtime, 1, Config);
 1538: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
 1539:     Config.
 1540: 
 1541: 
 1542: init_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
 1543:     io:format("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry with"
 1544:               "~n   Config: ~p"
 1545:               "~n", [_TC, Config]),
 1546:     Config.
 1547: 
 1548: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
 1549:     Config.
 1550: 
 1551: 
 1552: quiet_mode(Config) ->
 1553:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_quiet, 1, Config) of
 1554:         {value, {esock_test_quiet, Quiet}} ->
 1555:             Quiet;
 1556:         false ->
 1557:             case os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_QUIET") of
 1558:                 "true"  -> true;
 1559:                 "false" -> false;
 1560:                 _       -> default
 1561:             end
 1562:     end.
 1563:

 6696: ttest_simple_ssockt_csocko_small_tcp4(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6697:     Runtime = which_ttest_runtime(Config),

 6699:               Runtime,

 6702:               sock, once,

 6704: 	      false).

 6729: %% This test case uses the time test (ttest) utility to implement a 
 6730: %% ping-pong like test case.
 6731: %% Server:       Transport = socket(tcp), Active = true
 6732: %% Client:       Transport = socket(tcp), Active = once
 6733: %% Message Size: small (=1)

 6737: ttest_simple_ssockt_csocko_small_tcpL(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6738:     Runtime = which_ttest_runtime(Config),
 6739:     ttest_tcp(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 6740:               Runtime,
 6741:               local,
 6742:               sock, true,
 6743:               sock, once,
 6744:               1, ttest_small_max_outstanding(Config),
 6745: 	      false).
 6746: 
 6747: 
 6748: 
 6749: 
 6750: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6751: 
 6752: which_ttest_runtime(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6753:     case lists:keysearch(esock_test_ttest_runtime, 1, Config) of
 6754:         {value, {esock_test_ttest_runtime, Runtime}} ->
 6755:             Runtime;
 6756:         false ->
 6757:             which_ttest_runtime_env()
 6758:     end.
 6759: 
 6760: which_ttest_runtime_env() ->
 6761:     which_ttest_runtime_env(os:getenv("ESOCK_TEST_TTEST_RUNTIME")).
 6762: 
 6763: which_ttest_runtime_env(TStr) when is_list(TStr) ->
 6764:     which_ttest_runtime_env2(lists:reverse(TStr));
 6765: which_ttest_runtime_env(false) ->
 6766:     ?TTEST_RUNTIME.
 6767: 
 6768: 
 6769: %% The format is: <int>[unit]
 6770: %% where the optional unit can be:
 6771: %% ms: milliseconds
 6772: %% s:  seconds (default)
 6773: %% m:  minutes
 6774: which_ttest_runtime_env2([$s, $m | MS]) when (length(MS) > 0) ->
 6775:     convert_time(MS, fun(X) -> X end);
 6776: which_ttest_runtime_env2([$m | M]) when (length(M) > 0) ->
 6777:     convert_time(M, fun(X) -> ?MINS(X) end);
 6778: which_ttest_runtime_env2([$s | S]) when (length(S) > 0) ->
 6779:     convert_time(S, fun(X) -> ?SECS(X) end);
 6780: which_ttest_runtime_env2(S) ->
 6781:     convert_time(S, fun(X) -> ?SECS(X) end).
 6782: 
 6783: convert_time(TStrRev, Convert) ->
 6784:     try list_to_integer(lists:reverse(TStrRev)) of
 6785:         I -> Convert(I)
 6786:     catch
 6787:         _:_ ->
 6788:             ?TTEST_RUNTIME
 6789:     end.
 6790: 
 6791: %% ttest_tcp(TC,
 6792: %%           Domain,
 6793: %%           ServerMod, ServerActive,
 6794: %%           ClientMod, ClientActive,
 6795: %%           MsgID, MaxOutstanding) ->
 6796: %%     ttest_tcp(TC,
 6797: %%               ?TTEST_RUNTIME,
 6798: %%               Domain,
 6799: %%               ServerMod, ServerActive,
 6800: %%               ClientMod, ClientActive,
 6801: %%               MsgID, MaxOutstanding).
 6802: ttest_tcp(TC,
 6803:           Runtime,
 6804:           Domain,
 6805:           ServerMod, ServerActive,
 6806:           ClientMod, ClientActive,
 6807:           MsgID, MaxOutstanding) ->
 6808:     ttest_tcp(TC,
 6809: 	      Runtime,
 6810: 	      Domain,
 6811: 	      ServerMod, ServerActive,
 6812: 	      ClientMod, ClientActive,
 6813: 	      MsgID, MaxOutstanding, true).
 6814: 
 6815: ttest_tcp(TC,
 6816:           Runtime,
 6817:           Domain,
 6818:           ServerMod, ServerActive,
 6819:           ClientMod, ClientActive,
 6820:           MsgID, MaxOutstanding,
 6821: 	  Remote) ->
 6822:     tc_try(TC,
 6823:            fun() ->
 6824:                    if
 6825:  
 6826:                        (Domain =:= local) ->
 6827:                            %% On darwin we seem to hit the system limit(s)
 6828:                            %% much earlier.
 6829:                            %% The tests "mostly" work, but random cases fail
 6830:                            %% (even on reasonably powerful machines),
 6831:                            %% so its much simpler to just skip on darwin...
 6832:                            has_support_unix_domain_socket(),
 6833:                            is_not_darwin();
 6834:                        (Domain =:= inet) ->
 6835:                            has_support_ipv4();
 6836:                        (Domain =:= inet6) ->
 6837:                            has_support_ipv6();
 6838:                        true -> ok 
 6839:                    end
 6840:            end,
 6841:            fun() ->
 6842:                    %% This may be overkill, depending on the runtime,
 6843:                    %% but better safe then sorry...
 6844:                    ?TT(Runtime + ?SECS(60)),
 6845:                    ?P("Parameters: "
 6846:                       "~n   Domain:          ~p"
 6847:                       "~n   Message ID:      ~p"
 6848:                       "~n   Max Outstanding: ~p"
 6849:                       "~n   Running Time:    ~p"
 6850:                       "~n   Server Module:   ~p"
 6851:                       "~n   Server Active:   ~p"
 6852:                       "~n   Client Module:   ~p"
 6853:                       "~n   Client Active:   ~p"
 6854:                       "~n   Remote:          ~p",
 6855:                       [Domain, MsgID, MaxOutstanding, Runtime,
 6856:                        ServerMod, ServerActive, ClientMod, ClientActive,
 6857: 		       Remote]),
 6858:                    InitState = #{domain          => Domain,
 6859:                                  msg_id          => MsgID,
 6860:                                  max_outstanding => MaxOutstanding,
 6861:                                  runtime         => Runtime,
 6862:                                  server_mod      => ServerMod,
 6863:                                  server_active   => ServerActive,
 6864:                                  client_mod      => ClientMod,
 6865:                                  client_active   => ClientActive,
 6866: 				 remote          => Remote},
 6867:                    ok = ttest_tcp(InitState)
 6868:            end).
 6869: 
 6870: 
 6871: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 6872: 
 6873: ttest_tcp(InitState) ->
 6874:     ServerSeq =
 6875:         [
 6876:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 6877:          #{desc => "await start",
 6878:            cmd  => fun(State) ->
 6879:                            Tester = ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 6880:                            {ok, State#{tester => Tester}}
 6881:                    end},
 6882:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 6883:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 6884:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 6885:                            ok
 6886:                    end},
 6887: 
 6888: 
 6889:          %% *** Init part ***
 6890:          #{desc => "(maybe) create node",
 6891:            cmd  => fun(#{remote := true} = State) ->
 6892:                            {Peer, Node} = start_node("server"),
 6893: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("server node created:"
 6894: 				       "~n   Peer: ~p"
 6895: 				       "~n   Node: ~p", [Peer, Node]),
 6896:                            {ok, State#{peer => Peer, node => Node}};
 6897: 		      (State) ->
 6898: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("use local node for server"),
 6899: 			   {ok, State#{peer => undefined, node => node()}}
 6900:                    end},
 6901:          #{desc => "(maybe) monitor server node",
 6902:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) when (Node =/= node) ->
 6903:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 6904: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("~p monitored", [Node]),
 6905:                            ok;
 6906: 		      (_State) ->
 6907: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("nothing"),
 6908: 			   ok
 6909:                    end},
 6910:          #{desc => "start ttest (remote) server",
 6911:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local = Domain,
 6912:                          mod    := Mod,
 6913:                          active := Active,
 6914:                          node   := Node} = State) ->
 6915:                            case ttest_tcp_server_start(Node,
 6916:                                                        Domain, Mod, Active) of
 6917:                                {ok, {{Pid, _}, Path}} ->
 6918:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("server started: "
 6919:                                                "~n   Pid:  ~p"
 6920:                                                "~n   Path: ~p", [Pid, Path]),
 6921:                                    {ok, State#{rserver => Pid,
 6922:                                                path    => Path}};
 6923:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6924:                                    ERROR
 6925:                            end;
 6926:                       (#{domain := Domain,
 6927:                          mod    := Mod,
 6928:                          active := Active,
 6929:                          node   := Node} = State) ->
 6930:                            case ttest_tcp_server_start(Node,
 6931:                                                        Domain, Mod, Active) of
 6932:                                {ok, {{Pid, _}, {Addr, Port}}} ->
 6933:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("server started: "
 6934:                                                "~n   Pid:  ~p"
 6935:                                                "~n   Addr: ~p"
 6936:                                                "~n   Port: ~p",
 6937:                                                [Pid, Addr, Port]),
 6938:                                    {ok, State#{rserver => Pid,
 6939:                                                addr    => Addr,
 6940:                                                port    => Port}};
 6941:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 6942:                                    ERROR
 6943:                            end
 6944:                    end},
 6945:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 6946:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 6947:                          tester := Tester,
 6948:                          path   := Path}) ->
 6949:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, Path),
 6950:                            ok;
 6951:                       (#{tester := Tester,
 6952:                          addr   := Addr,
 6953:                          port   := Port}) ->
 6954:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init, {Addr, Port}),
 6955:                            ok
 6956:                    end},
 6957: 
 6958: 
 6959:          %% *** Termination ***
 6960:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 6961:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester, 
 6962:                          rserver := RServer} = State) ->
 6963:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester,
 6964:                                                      [{rserver, RServer}]) of
 6965:                                ok ->
 6966:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("received termination request"),
 6967:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 6968:                                {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 6969:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("received unexpected error: "
 6970:                                                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6971:                                    ERROR
 6972:                            end
 6973:                    end},
 6974:          %% The remote server is in a accept, with a timeout of 5 seconds,
 6975:          %% so may have to wait a bit...
 6976:          #{desc => "order (remote) ttest server terminate",
 6977:            cmd  => fun(#{node    := _Node,
 6978:                          rserver := RServer}) ->
 6979:                            ttest_tcp_server_stop(RServer),
 6980:                            ok
 6981:                    end},
 6982:          #{desc => "await ttest (remote) server termination",
 6983:            cmd  => fun(#{rserver := RServer} = State) ->
 6984:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RServer),
 6985:                            State1 = maps:remove(rserver, State),
 6986:                            {ok, State1}
 6987:                    end},
 6988:          #{desc => "(maybe) stop (server) node",
 6989:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State)  when (Peer =/= undefined) ->
 6990:                            {ok,
 6991:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 6992:                                 ok ->
 6993:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 6994:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 6995:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 6996:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 6997:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 6998:                             catch
 6999:                                 C:E:S ->
 7000:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 7001:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 7002:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 7003:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 7004:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 7005:                             end};
 7006: 		      (_) ->
 7007:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("nothing"),
 7008: 			   ok
 7009:                    end},
 7010:          #{desc => "(maybe) await (server) node termination",
 7011:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State)
 7012: 			 when (Node =/= node()) ->
 7013:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown"),
 7014:                            receive
 7015:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 7016:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 7017:                                    State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 7018:                                    {ok, State1}
 7019:                            end;
 7020:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 7021:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 7022:                            State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 7023:                            {ok, State1};
 7024: 		      (State) ->
 7025:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("nothing"),
 7026:                            State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 7027:                            {ok, State1}
 7028:                    end},
 7029: 
 7030: 
 7031:          %% *** We are done ***
 7032:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7033:         ],
 7034: 
 7035:     ClientSeq =
 7036:         [
 7037:          %% *** Wait for start order part ***
 7038:          #{desc => "await start",
 7039:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local} = State) ->
 7040:                            {Tester, ServerPath} = 
 7041:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7042:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("started with server info: "
 7043:                                        "~n   Path: ~p", [ServerPath]),
 7044:                            {ok, State#{tester      => Tester,
 7045:                                        server_path => ServerPath}};
 7046:                       (State) ->
 7047:                            {Tester, {ServerAddr, ServerPort}} = 
 7048:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_START(),
 7049:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("started with server info: "
 7050:                                        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 7051:                                        "~n   Port: ~p",
 7052:                                        [ServerAddr, ServerPort]),
 7053:                            {ok, State#{tester      => Tester,
 7054:                                        server_addr => ServerAddr,
 7055:                                        server_port => ServerPort}}
 7056:                    end},
 7057:          #{desc => "monitor tester",
 7058:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7059:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 7060:                            ok
 7061:                    end},
 7062: 
 7063: 
 7064:          %% *** Init part ***
 7065:          #{desc => "create node",
 7066:            cmd  => fun(#{remote := true, host := _Host} = State) ->
 7067:                            %% Because peer does not accept a host argument,
 7068:                            %% we can no longer start "remote" nodes...
 7069:                            %% Not that we actually did that. We always
 7070:                            %% used local-host.
 7071:                            {Peer, Node} = start_node("client"),
 7072:                            {ok, State#{peer => Peer, node => Node}};
 7073: 		      (State) ->
 7074: 			   {ok, State#{peer => undefined, node => node()}}
 7075:                    end},
 7076:          #{desc => "(maybe) monitor client node",
 7077:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node} = _State) when (Node =/= node()) ->
 7078:                            true = erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 7079: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("~p monitored", [Node]),
 7080:                            ok;
 7081: 		      (_) ->
 7082: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("nothing"),
 7083: 			   ok
 7084:                    end},
 7085:          #{desc => "announce ready (init)",
 7086:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester}) ->
 7087:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, init),
 7088:                            ok
 7089:                    end},
 7090: 
 7091: 
 7092:          %% The actual test
 7093:          #{desc => "await continue (ttest)",
 7094:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = _State) ->
 7095:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_CONTINUE(Tester, tester, ttest),
 7096:                            ok
 7097:                    end},
 7098:          #{desc => "start ttest (remote) client",
 7099:            cmd  => fun(#{domain          := local = Domain,
 7100:                          node            := Node,
 7101:                          mod             := Mod,
 7102:                          active          := Active,
 7103:                          msg_id          := MsgID,
 7104:                          max_outstanding := MaxOutstanding,
 7105:                          runtime         := RunTime,
 7106:                          server_path     := Path} = State) ->
 7107:                            Self   = self(),
 7108:                            Notify =
 7109:                                fun(Result) ->
 7110:                                        ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Self, ttest, Result)
 7111:                                end,                           
 7112:                            case ttest_tcp_client_start(Node, Notify,
 7113:                                                        Domain, Mod,
 7114:                                                        Path,
 7115:                                                        Active,
 7116:                                                        MsgID, MaxOutstanding,
 7117:                                                        RunTime) of
 7118:                                {ok, {Pid, _MRef}} ->
 7119:                                    {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}};
 7120:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7121:                                    ERROR
 7122:                            end;
 7123:                       (#{domain          := Domain,
 7124:                          node            := Node,
 7125:                          mod             := Mod,
 7126:                          active          := Active,
 7127:                          msg_id          := MsgID,
 7128:                          max_outstanding := MaxOutstanding,
 7129:                          runtime         := RunTime,
 7130:                          server_addr     := Addr,
 7131:                          server_port     := Port} = State) ->
 7132:                            Self   = self(),
 7133:                            Notify =
 7134:                                fun(Result) ->
 7135:                                        ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Self, ttest, Result)
 7136:                                end,                           
 7137:                            case ttest_tcp_client_start(Node, Notify,
 7138:                                                        Domain, Mod,
 7139:                                                        {Addr, Port},
 7140:                                                        Active,
 7141:                                                        MsgID, MaxOutstanding,
 7142:                                                        RunTime) of
 7143:                                {ok, {Pid, _MRef}} ->
 7144:                                    {ok, State#{rclient => Pid}};
 7145:                                {error, {connect, Reason, ServerInfo} = EI} ->
 7146:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed connecting to server: "
 7147:                                                "~n   Reason: ~p"
 7148:                                                "~n   Server: ~p",
 7149:                                                [Reason, ServerInfo]),
 7150:                                    case Reason of
 7151:                                        eaddrnotavail ->
 7152:                                            {skip, Reason};
 7153:                                        network_unreachable ->
 7154:                                            {skip, Reason};
 7155:                                        _ ->
 7156:                                            {error, EI}
 7157:                                    end;
 7158:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7159:                                    ERROR
 7160:                            end
 7161:                    end},
 7162:          #{desc => "await ttest ready",
 7163:            cmd  => fun(#{tester  := Tester,
 7164:                          rclient := RClient} = State) ->
 7165:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(RClient, rclient, ttest, 
 7166:                                                  [{tester, Tester}]) of
 7167:                              {ok, Result} ->
 7168:                                  {ok, State#{result => Result}};
 7169:                              {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7170:                                  ERROR
 7171:                          end
 7172:                    end},
 7173:          #{desc => "await ttest (remote) client termination",
 7174:            cmd  => fun(#{rclient := RClient} = State) ->
 7175:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(RClient),
 7176:                            State1 = maps:remove(rclient, State),
 7177:                            {ok, State1}
 7178:                    end},
 7179:          #{desc => "announce ready (ttest)",
 7180:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester,
 7181:                          result := Result} = State) ->
 7182:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_READY(Tester, ttest, Result),
 7183:                            {ok, maps:remove(result, State)}
 7184:                    end},
 7185: 
 7186: 
 7187:          %% *** Termination ***
 7188:          #{desc => "await terminate (from tester)",
 7189:            cmd  => fun(#{tester := Tester} = State) ->
 7190:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATE(Tester, tester) of
 7191:                                ok ->
 7192:                                    {ok, maps:remove(tester, State)};
 7193:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7194:                                    ERROR
 7195:                            end
 7196:                    end},
 7197:          #{desc => "(maybe) stop (client) node",
 7198:            cmd  => fun(#{peer := Peer} = State) when (Peer =/= undefined) ->
 7199:                            {ok,
 7200:                             try peer:stop(Peer) of
 7201:                                 ok ->
 7202:                                     State#{node_stop => ok};
 7203:                                 {error, Reason} ->
 7204:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 7205:                                                 "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 7206:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 7207:                             catch
 7208:                                 C:E:S ->
 7209:                                     ?SEV_EPRINT("Unexpected node stop result: "
 7210:                                                 "~n   Class: ~p"
 7211:                                                 "~n   Error: ~p"
 7212:                                                 "~n   Stack: ~p",[C, E, S]),
 7213:                                     State#{node_stop => error}
 7214:                             end};
 7215: 		      (_) ->
 7216: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("nothing"),
 7217: 			   ok
 7218:                    end},
 7219:          #{desc => "(maybe) await (client) node termination",
 7220:            cmd  => fun(#{node := Node, node_stop := ok} = State)
 7221: 			 when (Node =/= node()) ->
 7222:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Success node stop - await nodedown"),
 7223:                            receive
 7224:                                {nodedown, Node} ->
 7225:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT("nodedown received - cleanup"),
 7226:                                    State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 7227:                                    {ok, State1}
 7228:                            end;
 7229:                       (#{node_stop := error} = State) ->
 7230:                            ?SEV_IPRINT("Failed node stop - cleanup"),
 7231:                            State1 = maps:remove(node, State),
 7232:                            {ok, State1};
 7233: 		      (_) ->
 7234: 			   ?SEV_IPRINT("nothing"),
 7235: 			   ok
 7236:                    end},
 7237: 
 7238: 
 7239:          %% *** We are done ***
 7240:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7241:         ],
 7242: 
 7243:     TesterSeq =
 7244:         [
 7245:          %% *** Init part ***
 7246:          #{desc => "monitor server",
 7247:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7248:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7249:                            ok
 7250:                    end},
 7251:          #{desc => "monitor client",
 7252:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Pid} = _State) ->
 7253:                            _MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7254:                            ok
 7255:                    end},
 7256: 
 7257:          %% Start the server
 7258:          #{desc => "order server start",
 7259:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Pid} = _State) ->
 7260:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid),
 7261:                            ok
 7262:                    end},
 7263:          #{desc => "await server ready (init)",
 7264:            cmd  => fun(#{domain := local,
 7265:                          server := Pid} = State) ->
 7266:                            {ok, Path} = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
 7267:                            {ok, State#{server_path => Path}};
 7268:                       (#{server := Pid} = State) ->
 7269:                            {ok, {Addr, Port}} =
 7270:                                ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Pid, server, init),
 7271:                            {ok, State#{server_addr => Addr,
 7272:                                        server_port => Port}}
 7273:                    end},
 7274: 
 7275: 
 7276:          %% Start the client
 7277:          #{desc => "order client start",
 7278:            cmd  => fun(#{domain      := local,
 7279:                          client      := Pid,
 7280:                          server_path := Path} = _State) ->
 7281:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, Path),
 7282:                            ok;
 7283:                       (#{client      := Pid,
 7284:                          server_addr := Addr,
 7285:                          server_port := Port} = _State) ->
 7286:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_START(Pid, {Addr, Port}),
 7287:                            ok
 7288:                    end},
 7289:          #{desc => "await client ready (init)",
 7290:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 7291:                            ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, init)
 7292:                    end},
 7293:  
 7294:          %% The actual test
 7295:          #{desc => "order client continue (ttest)",
 7296:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 7297:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_CONTINUE(Client, ttest),
 7298:                            ok
 7299:                    end},
 7300:          #{desc => "await client ready (ttest)",
 7301:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server,
 7302:                          client := Client} = State) ->
 7303:                            case ?SEV_AWAIT_READY(Client, client, ttest,
 7304:                                                  [{server, Server}]) of
 7305:                                {ok, Result} ->
 7306:                                    {ok, State#{result => Result}};
 7307:                                {error, _} = ERROR ->
 7308:                                    ERROR
 7309:                            end
 7310:                    end},
 7311: 
 7312: 
 7313:          %% *** Terminate server ***
 7314:          #{desc => "order client terminate",
 7315:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = _State) ->
 7316:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Client),
 7317:                            ok
 7318:                    end},
 7319:          #{desc => "await client down",
 7320:            cmd  => fun(#{client := Client} = State) ->
 7321:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Client),
 7322:                            State1 = maps:remove(client,    State),
 7323:                            {ok, State1}
 7324:                    end},
 7325:          #{desc => "order server terminate",
 7326:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 7327:                            ?SEV_ANNOUNCE_TERMINATE(Server),
 7328:                            ok
 7329:                    end},
 7330:          #{desc => "await server down",
 7331:            cmd  => fun(#{server := Server} = _State) ->
 7332:                            ?SEV_AWAIT_TERMINATION(Server),
 7333:                            ok
 7334:                    end},
 7335: 
 7336:          
 7337:          %% Present the results
 7338:          #{desc => "present the results",
 7339:            cmd  => fun(#{result        := Result,
 7340:                          domain        := Domain,
 7341:                          server_mod    := ServerTrans,
 7342:                          server_active := ServerActive,
 7343:                          client_mod    := ClientTrans,
 7344:                          client_active := ClientActive,
 7345:                          msg_id        := MsgID} = State) ->
 7346:                            case Result of
 7347:                                #{status  := ok,
 7348:                                  runtime := RunTime,
 7349:                                  cnt     := Cnt,
 7350:                                  bcnt    := BCnt} ->
 7351:                                    ttest_report(Domain,
 7352:                                                 ServerTrans, ServerActive,
 7353:                                                 ClientTrans, ClientActive,
 7354:                                                 MsgID,
 7355:                                                 RunTime, BCnt, Cnt),
 7356:                                    ?SEV_IPRINT(
 7357:                                       "TTest results: "
 7358:                                       "~n   Run Time:                    ~s"
 7359:                                       "~n   Byte Count:                  ~s"
 7360:                                       "~n   Number of message exchanges: ~s"
 7361:                                       "~n~n",
 7362:                                       [
 7363:                                        ?TTEST_LIB:format_time(RunTime),
 7364:                                        if ((BCnt =:= 0) orelse (RunTime =:= 0)) ->
 7365:                                                ?TTEST_LIB:format("~w, ~w",
 7366:                                                                  [BCnt, RunTime]);
 7367:                                           true ->
 7368:                                                ?TTEST_LIB:format("~p => ~p byte / ms",
 7369:                                                                  [BCnt, BCnt div RunTime])
 7370:                                        end,
 7371:                                        if (RunTime =:= 0) ->
 7372:                                                "-";
 7373:                                           true ->
 7374:                                                ?TTEST_LIB:format("~p => ~p iterations / ms",
 7375:                                                                  [Cnt, Cnt div RunTime])
 7376:                                        end
 7377:                                       ]),
 7378:                                    {ok, maps:remove(result, State)};
 7379: 
 7380:                                #{status  := Failure,
 7381:                                  runtime := RunTime,
 7382:                                  sid     := SID,
 7383:                                  rid     := RID,
 7384:                                  scnt    := SCnt,
 7385:                                  rcnt    := RCnt,
 7386:                                  bcnt    := BCnt,
 7387:                                  num     := Num} ->
 7388:                                    ?SEV_EPRINT("Time Test failed: "
 7389:                                                "~n   ~p"
 7390:                                                "~n"
 7391:                                                "~nwhen"
 7392:                                                "~n"
 7393:                                                "~n   Run Time:       ~s"
 7394:                                                "~n   Send ID:        ~p"
 7395:                                                "~n   Recv ID:        ~p"
 7396:                                                "~n   Send Count:     ~p"
 7397:                                                "~n   Recv Count:     ~p"
 7398:                                                "~n   Byte Count:     ~p"
 7399:                                                "~n   Num Iterations: ~p",
 7400:                                                [Failure,
 7401:                                                 ?TTEST_LIB:format_time(RunTime),
 7402:                                                 SID, RID, SCnt, RCnt, BCnt, Num]),
 7403:                                    {error, Failure}
 7404:                            end
 7405:                    end},
 7406: 
 7407:          %% This is just so that the printout above shall have time to come
 7408:          %% out before then end of the test case.
 7409:          ?SEV_SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 7410: 
 7411:          %% *** We are done ***
 7412:          ?SEV_FINISH_NORMAL
 7413:         ],
 7414: 
 7415:     Domain = maps:get(domain, InitState),
 7416:     LHost  = local_host(),
 7417:     LAddr  = which_local_addr(Domain),
 7418: 
 7419:     i("start server evaluator"),
 7420:     ServerInitState = #{host   => LHost,
 7421: 			addr   => LAddr,
 7422:                         domain => Domain,
 7423:                         mod    => maps:get(server_mod,    InitState),
 7424:                         active => maps:get(server_active, InitState)},
 7425:     Server          = ?SEV_START("server", ServerSeq, ServerInitState),
 7426: 
 7427:     i("start client evaluator"),
 7428:     ClientInitState = #{host            => LHost,
 7429: 			addr            => LAddr,
 7430:                         domain          => Domain,
 7431:                         mod             => maps:get(client_mod,      InitState),
 7432:                         active          => maps:get(client_active,   InitState),
 7433:                         msg_id          => maps:get(msg_id,          InitState),
 7434:                         max_outstanding => maps:get(max_outstanding, InitState),
 7435:                         runtime         => maps:get(runtime,         InitState)},
 7436:     Client          = ?SEV_START("client", ClientSeq, ClientInitState),
 7437:     
 7438:     i("start 'tester' evaluator"),
 7439:     TesterInitState = #{domain        => Domain,
 7440: 			msg_id        => maps:get(msg_id,        InitState),
 7441:                         client        => Client#ev.pid,
 7442: 			client_mod    => maps:get(client_mod,    InitState),
 7443: 			client_active => maps:get(client_active, InitState),
 7444:                         server        => Server#ev.pid,
 7445:                         server_mod    => maps:get(server_mod,    InitState),
 7446:                         server_active => maps:get(server_active, InitState)},
 7447:     Tester = ?SEV_START("tester", TesterSeq, TesterInitState),
 7448: 
 7449:     i("await evaluator(s)"),
 7450:     ok = ?SEV_AWAIT_FINISH([Server, Client, Tester]).
 7451: 
 7452: 
 7453: 
 7454: ttest_tcp_server_start(Node, Domain, gen, Active) ->
 7455:     TransportMod = socket_test_ttest_tcp_gen,
 7456:     Transport    = {TransportMod, #{domain => Domain}},
 7457:     socket_test_ttest_tcp_server:start_monitor(Node, Transport, Active);
 7458: ttest_tcp_server_start(Node, Domain, gs, Active) ->
 7459:     TransportMod = socket_test_ttest_tcp_gs,
 7460:     Transport    = {TransportMod, #{domain => Domain}},
 7461:     socket_test_ttest_tcp_server:start_monitor(Node, Transport, Active);
 7462: ttest_tcp_server_start(Node, Domain, sock, Active) ->
 7463:     TransportMod = socket_test_ttest_tcp_socket,
 7464:     Transport    = {TransportMod, #{domain => Domain,
 7465:                                     async  => true,
 7466:                                     method => plain}},
 7467:     socket_test_ttest_tcp_server:start_monitor(Node, Transport, Active).
 7468: 
 7469: ttest_tcp_server_stop(Pid) ->
 7470:     socket_test_ttest_tcp_server:stop(Pid).
 7471: 
 7472: ttest_tcp_client_start(Node,
 7473:                        Notify,
 7474:                        Domain, gen,
 7475:                        ServerInfo, Active, MsgID, MaxOutstanding, RunTime) ->
 7476:     TransportMod = socket_test_ttest_tcp_gen,
 7477:     Transport    = {TransportMod, #{domain => Domain}},    
 7478:     socket_test_ttest_tcp_client:start_monitor(Node,
 7479:                                                Notify,
 7480:                                                Transport,
 7481:                                                ServerInfo,
 7482:                                                Active,
 7483:                                                MsgID, MaxOutstanding, RunTime);
 7484: ttest_tcp_client_start(Node,
 7485:                        Notify,
 7486:                        Domain, gs,
 7487:                        ServerInfo, Active, MsgID, MaxOutstanding, RunTime) ->
 7488:     TransportMod = socket_test_ttest_tcp_gs,
 7489:     Transport    = {TransportMod, #{domain => Domain}},    
 7490:     socket_test_ttest_tcp_client:start_monitor(Node,
 7491:                                                Notify,
 7492:                                                Transport,
 7493:                                                ServerInfo,
 7494:                                                Active,
 7495:                                                MsgID, MaxOutstanding, RunTime);
 7496: ttest_tcp_client_start(Node,
 7497:                        Notify,
 7498:                        Domain, sock,
 7499:                        ServerInfo, Active, MsgID, MaxOutstanding, RunTime) ->
 7500:     TransportMod = socket_test_ttest_tcp_socket,
 7501:     Transport    = {TransportMod, #{domain => Domain,
 7502:                                     async  => true,
 7503:                                     method => plain}},
 7504:     socket_test_ttest_tcp_client:start_monitor(Node,
 7505:                                                Notify,
 7506:                                                Transport,
 7507:                                                ServerInfo,
 7508:                                                Active,
 7509:                                                MsgID, MaxOutstanding, RunTime).
 7510: 
 7511: 
 7512: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7513: 
 7514: -define(TTEST_MANAGER, esock_ttest_manager).
 7515: 
 7516: -record(ttest_report_id,
 7517:         {domain        :: socket:domain(),
 7518:          serv_trans    :: gen | sock,
 7519:          serv_active   :: once | boolean(),
 7520:          client_trans  :: gen | sock,
 7521:          client_active :: once | boolean(),
 7522:          msg_id        :: small | medium | large}).
 7523: 
 7524: -record(ttest_report, {id    :: #ttest_report_id{},
 7525:                        time  :: non_neg_integer(),
 7526:                        bytes :: non_neg_integer(),
 7527:                        msgs  :: non_neg_integer()}).
 7528: 
 7529: -spec ttest_report(Domain      :: socket:domain(),
 7530:                    ServTrans   :: gen | sock, ServActive   :: once | boolean(),
 7531:                    ClientTrans :: gen | sock, ClientActive :: once | boolean(),
 7532:                    MsgID       :: 1 | 2 | 3,
 7533:                    RunTime     :: non_neg_integer(),
 7534:                    NumBytes    :: non_neg_integer(),
 7535:                    NumMsgs     :: non_neg_integer()) -> ok.
 7536: 
 7537: ttest_report(Domain,
 7538:              ServTrans,   ServActive,
 7539:              ClientTrans, ClientActive,
 7540:              MsgID,
 7541:              RunTime,
 7542:              NumBytes,
 7543:              NumMsgs) ->
 7544:     ID = #ttest_report_id{domain        = Domain,
 7545:                           serv_trans    = ServTrans,
 7546:                           serv_active   = ServActive,
 7547:                           client_trans  = ClientTrans,
 7548:                           client_active = ClientActive,
 7549:                           msg_id        = ttest_msg_id_num_to_name(MsgID)},
 7550:     Report = #ttest_report{id    = ID,
 7551:                            time  = RunTime,
 7552:                            bytes = NumBytes,
 7553:                            msgs  = NumMsgs},
 7554:     %% If we run just one test case, the group init has never been run
 7555:     %% and therefore the ttest manager is not running (we also don't actually
 7556:     %% care about collecting reports in that case).
 7557:     (catch global:send(?TTEST_MANAGER, Report)),
 7558:     ok.
 7559: 
 7560: ttest_msg_id_num_to_name(1) ->
 7561:     small;
 7562: ttest_msg_id_num_to_name(2) ->
 7563:     medium;
 7564: ttest_msg_id_num_to_name(3) ->
 7565:     large.
 7566:     
 7567: ttest_manager_start() ->
 7568:     Self = self(),
 7569:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> ttest_manager_init(Self) end),
 7570:     receive
 7571:         {ttest_manager_started, Pid} ->
 7572:             erlang:demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 7573:             ok;
 7574:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 7575:             exit({failed_starting, ttest_manager, Reason})
 7576:     after 5000 ->
 7577:             exit(Pid, kill),
 7578:             exit({failed_starting, ttest_manager, timeout})
 7579:     end.
 7580: 
 7581: ttest_manager_stop() ->
 7582:     case global:whereis_name(?TTEST_MANAGER) of
 7583:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 7584:             erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 7585:             global:send(?TTEST_MANAGER, stop),
 7586:             receive
 7587:                 {'DOWN', _MRef, process, Pid, _} ->
 7588:                     ok
 7589:             after 10000 ->
 7590:                     exit(Pid, kill),
 7591:                     ok
 7592:             end;
 7593:         _ ->
 7594:             ok
 7595:     end.
 7596: 
 7597: ttest_manager_init(Parent) ->
 7598:     yes = global:register_name(?TTEST_MANAGER, self()),
 7599:     ets:new(?TTEST_MANAGER, 
 7600:             [{keypos, #ttest_report.id}, named_table, protected, ordered_set]),
 7601:     Parent ! {ttest_manager_started, self()},
 7602:     ttest_manager_loop().
 7603: 
 7604: ttest_manager_loop() ->
 7605:     receive
 7606:         stop ->
 7607:             ?LOGGER:format("manager stopping~n", []),
 7608:             ttest_manager_done();
 7609: 
 7610:         #ttest_report{id    = _ID,
 7611:                       time  = _RunTime,
 7612:                       bytes = _NumBytes,
 7613:                       msgs  = _NumMsgs} = Report ->
 7614:             true = ets:insert_new(?TTEST_MANAGER, Report),
 7615:             ttest_manager_loop()
 7616:     end.
 7617: 
 7618: %% We are supposed to pretty print the result here...
 7619: ttest_manager_done() ->
 7620:     format_reports(inet),
 7621:     %% format_reports(inet6),
 7622:     ets:delete(?TTEST_MANAGER),
 7623:     exit(normal).
 7624: 
 7625: format_reports(Domain) ->
 7626:     ?LOGGER:format("Domain ~w reports:~n~n", [Domain]),
 7627:     format_reports(Domain, small),
 7628:     format_reports(Domain, medium),
 7629:     format_reports(Domain, large).
 7630:     
 7631: format_reports(Domain, MsgID) when is_atom(MsgID) ->
 7632:     case which_ttest_reports(Domain, MsgID) of
 7633:         [] ->
 7634:             ?LOGGER:format("   No ~w reports~n~n", [MsgID]);
 7635:         Reports ->
 7636:             ?LOGGER:format("   ~w reports: ~n", [MsgID]),
 7637:             lists:foreach(fun(R) -> format_report(R) end, Reports)
 7638:     end.
 7639: 
 7640: %% This should really be a table like this:
 7641: %%
 7642: %%             client
 7643: %% server      gen(false)  gen(once)  gen(true)  sock(false)  sock(once)  sock(true)
 7644: %% gen(false)  nnn
 7645: %% gen(once)   nnn
 7646: %% gen(true)   nnn
 7647: %% sock(false) nnn
 7648: %% sock(once)  nnn
 7649: %% sock(true)  nnn
 7650: %%
 7651: format_report(#ttest_report{id    = #ttest_report_id{serv_trans    = STrans,
 7652:                                                      serv_active   = SActive,
 7653:                                                      client_trans  = CTrans,
 7654:                                                      client_active = CActive},
 7655:                             time  = RunTime,
 7656:                             bytes = BCnt,
 7657:                             msgs  = MCnt}) ->
 7658:     ?LOGGER:format("      server ~w[~w] - client ~w[~w] => "
 7659:                    "~n         Run Time: ~s"
 7660:                    "~n         Bytes:    ~s"
 7661:                    "~n         Messages: ~s"
 7662:                    "~n", [STrans, SActive, CTrans, CActive,
 7663:                           ?TTEST_LIB:format_time(RunTime),
 7664:                           if ((BCnt =:= 0) orelse (RunTime =:= 0)) ->
 7665:                                   ?TTEST_LIB:format("~w, ~w",
 7666:                                                     [BCnt, RunTime]);
 7667:                              true ->
 7668:                                   ?TTEST_LIB:format("~p => ~p byte / ms",
 7669:                                                     [BCnt, BCnt div RunTime])
 7670:                           end,
 7671:                           if (RunTime =:= 0) ->
 7672:                                   "-";
 7673:                              true ->
 7674:                                   ?TTEST_LIB:format("~p => ~p iterations / ms",
 7675:                                                     [MCnt, MCnt div RunTime])
 7676:                           end]),
 7677:     ok.
 7678: 
 7679: 
 7680: which_ttest_reports(Domain, all) ->
 7681:     [R || R = #ttest_report{id = #ttest_report_id{domain = D}} <- 
 7682:               ets:tab2list(?TTEST_MANAGER), Domain =:= D];
 7683: which_ttest_reports(Domain, MsgID) ->
 7684:     [R || R = #ttest_report{id = #ttest_report_id{domain = D, msg_id = MID}} <- 
 7685:               ets:tab2list(?TTEST_MANAGER), (Domain =:= D) andalso
 7686:                                                              (MsgID =:= MID)].
 7687: 
 7688: 
 7689: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7690: 
 7691: local_host() ->
 7692:     try net_adm:localhost() of
 7693:         Host when is_list(Host) ->
 7694: 	    %% Convert to shortname if long
 7695: 	    case string:tokens(Host, [$.]) of
 7696: 		[H|_] ->
 7697: 		    list_to_atom(H)
 7698: 	    end
 7699:     catch
 7700:         C:E:S ->
 7701:             erlang:raise(C, E, S)
 7702:     end.
 7703: 
 7704: 
 7705: %% The point of this is to "ensure" that paths from different test runs
 7706: %% don't clash.
 7707: 
 7708: mk_unique_path() ->
 7709:     ?SLIB:mk_unique_path().
 7710: 
 7711: 
 7712: which_local_addr(local = _Domain) ->
 7713:     mk_unique_path();
 7714: 
 7715: %% This gets the local address (not 127.0...)
 7716: %% We should really implement this using the (new) net module,
 7717: %% but until that gets the necessary functionality...
 7718: which_local_addr(Domain) ->
 7719:     ?KLIB:which_local_addr(Domain).
 7720: 
 7721: 
 7722: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7723: 
 7724: %% Here are all the *general* test case condition functions.
 7725: 
 7726: is_not_darwin() ->
 7727:     is_not_platform(darwin, "Darwin").
 7728: 
 7729: is_not_platform(Platform, PlatformStr)
 7730:   when is_atom(Platform) andalso is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 7731:       case os:type() of
 7732:           {unix, Platform} ->
 7733:               skip("This does not work on " ++ PlatformStr);
 7734:         _ ->
 7735:             ok
 7736:     end.
 7737:   
 7738: 
 7739: has_support_unix_domain_socket() ->
 7740:     case socket:is_supported(local) of
 7741: 	true ->
 7742: 	    ok;
 7743: 	false ->
 7744: 	    skip("Not supported")
 7745:     end.
 7746: 
 7747: 
 7748: %% The idea is that this function shall test if the test host has 
 7749: %% support for IPv4 or IPv6. If not, there is no point in running 
 7750: %% corresponding tests.
 7751: %% Currently we just skip.
 7752: has_support_ipv4() ->
 7753:     ?KLIB:has_support_ipv4().
 7754: 
 7755: has_support_ipv6() ->
 7756:     ?KLIB:has_support_ipv6().
 7757:

 7763:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 7764:

 7769:     %% ?KLIB:tc_try(Case, TCCondFun, TCFun).
 7770:     ?TC_TRY(Case, TCCondFun, TCFun).
 7771:

 7773: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7774: 
 7775: start_node(Name) ->
 7776:     start_node(Name, 5000).
 7777: 
 7778: start_node(Name, Timeout) when is_integer(Timeout) andalso (Timeout > 0) ->
 7779:     try ?CT_PEER(#{name => Name, wait_boot => Timeout}) of
 7780:         {ok, Peer, Node} ->
 7781:             ?SEV_IPRINT("Started node ~p", [Name]),
 7782:             {Peer, Node};
 7783:         {error, Reason} ->
 7784:             ?SEV_EPRINT("failed starting node ~p (=> SKIP):"
 7785:                         "~n   ~p", [Name, Reason]),
 7786:             skip(Reason)
 7787:     catch
 7788:         Class:Reason:Stack ->
 7789:             ?SEV_EPRINT("Failed starting node: "
 7790:                         "~n   Class:  ~p"
 7791:                         "~n   Reason: ~p"
 7792:                         "~n   Stack:  ~p",
 7793:                         [Class, Reason, Stack]),
 7794:             skip({node_start, Class, Reason})
 7795:     end.
 7796: 
 7797:             
 7798: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 7799: 
 7800: i(F) ->
 7801:     i(F, []).
 7802: 
 7803: i(F, A) ->
 7804:     FStr = ?F("[~s] " ++ F, [?FTS()|A]),
 7805:     io:format(user, FStr ++ "~n", []),
 7806:     io:format(FStr, []).
 7807:
